title: Manchester United to splash £300 million transfer kitty in bid to rebuild their squad
text:
Manchester united have a kitty of £300million to rebuild their squad and are aiming to tie up several big signings for next summer.

United have been heavily linked with Lyon striker Moussa Dembele and Leicester City playmaker James Maddison but are prepared to wait until the summer if neither is available at the right price in January. Atletico Madrid midfielder Saul Niguez has also been monitored.

In the short-term, manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has asked his players to be more positive on the ball in a bid to rise up the table.

Manchester United will splash £300million on big name signings in the next transfer window

United have been heavily linked with a big money move for Leicester star James Maddison

‘The coaching here is excellent and we are just waiting for that to flourish,’ said Solskjaer.

'You can see loads of it, the defensive part, which is giving us a platform to play from. That last bit is going to come because we have players with that flair.

‘Maybe young players want to play safe but you have to take risks at this club, you can’t play safe. One of my big philosophies is you attack quickly. You want to win the ball in great positions to attack from, but teams are so quickly back into shape these days you lose that moment of transition in one or two less positive passes.’

Sunday's game pits together England’s most expensive defenders, £80m Harry Maguire and Virgil van Dijk (£75m). Solskjaer has backed Maguire despite an indifferent start, saying: ‘Harry is a leader. It’s just there are different types of leaders.’

authors: Joe Bernstein For The Mail On Sunday
